title: Integrate jieba-rs for Chinese word segmentation
Implement native Chinese G2P (ZHG2P) in Rust
description:
Port misaki's ZHG2P (Chinese Grapheme-to-Phoneme) to pure Rust for native Chinese TTS support.

## Components to Port
1. Word segmentation (jieba-rs available)
2. Pinyin conversion (pinyin crate available)  
3. Number conversion (chinese-number crate available)
4. Tone sandhi rules (~400 lines to port)
5. Pinyin-to-IPA transcription (~250 lines)
6. ZH frontend with erhua handling (~200 lines)

## Estimated Effort
~930 lines of Rust, 5-8 days

## Reference
See history/chinese-g2p-feasibility.md for detailed analysis.

## Model Support
This enables support for Kokoro v1.1-zh Chinese model (103 voices).

title: Add Kokoro v1.1-zh model support
description:
Add support for the Chinese-specialized Kokoro model:

## Model Details
- Model: hexgrad/Kokoro-82M-v1.1-zh
- Parameters: 82M
- Voices: 103 (100 Chinese + 3 English)

## Files Required
- kokoro-v1.1-zh.onnx
- voices-v1.1-zh.bin  
- config.json

## Dependencies
Requires Chinese G2P (kokorox-bz9) to be implemented first.

## Tasks
1. Add model download to scripts/download_models.sh
2. Add voice download to scripts/download_voices.sh
3. Integrate with koko CLI for zh language selection
4. Test with sample Chinese text

title: Add markdown/markup stripping before TTS synthesis
description: Strip markdown formatting (headers, bold, italic, code blocks, links, etc.) from text before sending to Kokoro for synthesis. Raw markdown symbols like **, ##, ```, etc. should not be spoken aloud.
